author: potuz
content:
There are only three slashable offenses: 1) proposing two different blocks for the same floor
2) attesting for two different blocks in the same turn
3) another technical condition on attestations called a "surrounding attestation".

Voting for a non canonical chain or a minority chain is not slashable. Nor should it be: honest validators may be eclipsed or be on a networking isolated environment. What would happen in this scenario is that from the point of view of the (evil) majority chain, the minority validators will be off line, and they will be losing balance accordingly
